recommendations: Scott Kelly
Founder, CEO and President at Black Dog Venture Partners
May 26, 2017, Scott worked with Dave but at different companies

We hosted our Investor Roundtable at UAT. Dave and his staff made our event a huge success and the best we have hosted in AZ. The entire staff bent over backwards to help us and smiled the entire time. I hope to host future events there. UAT is a hidden gem of higher education but I am sure that won't be the case for long with Dave's leadership.

Dennis White
IT Professional III at State of Nevada
August 20, 2011, Dave was senior to Dennis but didn’t manage directly

I was a student of Dave's many many years ago...  My near 20 year career in software development can be linked right back to Dave and a conversation he had with myself and another classmate. I was working on my degree in Electro-Mechanical engineering and in my final semester took a programming class in C/C++ which he was teaching at the time. I had so much fun in the class creating software and doing things like writing software to talk to a robotic arm or a CAM table.Then it came with one simple sentence from Dave towards the end of the semester. I will never forget it and even to this day I tell people it's how I got into this line of work.Dave - "You know they pay people to do stuff like this for a living?" I mean I knew there were software companies out there but I never really thought about it actually being a real job. My thoughts back then are the same they are now... You mean I can actually get paid to do something that is this much fun?
Dennis White
IT Professional III at State of Nevada

Raymond Blackwood
Vice President of Product Management at Campus Management Corp
November 26, 2010, Raymond reported directly to Dave

Dave first made an impression on me as a college freshman. The first day of orientation he walked in as the head of education doing amazing yo-yo tricks and established the expectations of what it was like to be a student at his school. Dave made a lasting impression on me that day, it was August 26th, 1996. Fortunately, I not only graduated, but was hired as an employee at the University during my sophomore year. Several years later and for about 10 years after that, Dave was assigned to be my mentor. Year after year, he helped me take a new perspective on life and work, worked to cultivate my ability to balance work, personal relationships and health, write, lecture, lead and challenge all of my ideas so that they could be tactically and practically implemented. Dave is highly intelligent, well read and committed to continual improvement in his programs. I am grateful to have had him as my mentor as I grew up in the world of higher education and at the game of life.
Raymond Blackwood
Vice President of Product Management at Campus Management Corp

September 29, 2015, Dave was senior to Bron but didn’t manage directly

On behalf of UAT, I am writing this letter of reference for Mr. Bron Stadheim. After knowing and working him over several years, I very much affirm that Bron is worthy of your consideration as member of your team.	While at UAT, Mr. Stadheim served in a number of roles and did them well. Throughout his time with us, Bron cultivated a presence and reputation for being someone who was thoughtful, trustworthy, constant and a presence who bonded diverse teams together.  Through his calm and caring demeanor, Bron was quite good at helping individuals as they worked through difficult projects and the occasional conflict. His success with teams is helped by the intelligent wit that Bron uses to lighten the mood and tempo of work when such a break is needed.    As a final point, Bron’s ethics, commitment and treatment of others are beyond reproach. I truly hope that you consider Mr. Stadheim in a positive light as you evaluate candidates. There are few members of UAT staff who I recommend as strongly as Bron. With this in mind, please feel welcome in reaching out to me with any questions that you may have.
Bron Stadheim
Account Executive, SMB at ZipRecruiter
